project.name: Keydrown
project.description: A JavaScript key state handler for web apps

kd.Key.name: kd.Key
kd.Key.description:
Represents a key on the keyboard.  You'll never actually call this method
directly; Key Objects for every key that Keydrown supports are created for
you when the library is initialized (as in, when the file is loaded).  You
will, however, use the `prototype` methods below to bind functions to key
states.

params.name: iterator
params.description: The function to call for each property.

classitems.description: Create a transposed copy of an Object.
Implementation of Array#indexOf because IE<9 doesn't support it.

return.description: Index of the found element or -1 if not found.

classitems.description: Push a value onto an array if it is not present in the array already.  Otherwise, this is a no-op.

return.description: Whether or not the value was added to the array.

classitems.description:
Remove a value from an array.  Assumes there is only one instance of the
value present in the array.

return.description:
The value that was removed from arr.  Returns undefined if
nothing was removed.

classitems.description:
Cross-browser function for listening for and handling an event on the
document element.
Lookup table of keys to keyCodes.
Returns whether the key is currently pressed or not.
classitems.name: isDown

return.description: True if the key is down, otherwise false.

classitems.description: Bind a function to be called when the key is held down.
classitems.name: down

params.name: opt_handler
params.description:
The function to be called when the key is
held down.  If omitted, this function invokes whatever handler was
previously bound.

classitems.description: Bind a function to be called when the key is released.
classitems.name: up

params.name: opt_handler
params.description:
The function to be called when the key is
released.  If omitted, this function invokes whatever handler was
previously bound.

params.name: opt_evt
params.description:
If this function is being called by the
keyup event handler, this is the raw KeyboardEvent Object provided from
the browser.  This should generally not be provided by client code.

classitems.description:
Bind a function to be called when the key is pressed.  This handler will
not fire again until the key is released â€” it does not repeat.
classitems.name: press

params.name: opt_handler
params.description:
The function to be called once when the key
is pressed.  If omitted, this function invokes whatever handler was
previously bound.

params.name: opt_evt
params.description:
If this function is being called by the
keydown event handler, this is the raw KeyboardEvent Object provided from
the browser.  This should generally not be provided by client code.

classitems.description:
Remove the handler that was bound with `{{#crossLink
"kd.Key/down:method"}}{{/crossLink}}`.
classitems.name: unbindDown

classitems.description:
Remove the handler that was bound with `{{#crossLink
"kd.Key/up:method"}}{{/crossLink}}`.
classitems.name: unbindUp

classitems.description:
Remove the handler that was bound with `{{#crossLink
"kd.Key/press:method"}}{{/crossLink}}`.
classitems.name: unbindPress

classitems.description: Evaluate which keys are held down and invoke their handler functions.
classitems.name: tick

classitems.description: A basic run loop.  `handler` gets called approximately 60 times a second.

params.name: handler
params.description:
The callback function to call on
every tick.  You likely want to call [kd.tick](#method_tick) in this
function.  This callback receives the time elapsed since the previous
execution of the callback as the first parameter, and the current time
stamp as the second.

classitems.name: run
